intro: Alkanna viscidula, commonly known as sticky alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its sticky texture. Alkanna viscidula is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
